comment.realname: State Library of New South Wales
comment.author: 29454428@N08
comment._content: If you're interested in Nancy's autobiography, it is held at many public libraries across Australia. If yours doesn't hold it, you can order it on inter library loan. Search for it on Libraries Australia librariesaustralia.nla.gov.au/
comment.authorname: State Library of New South Wales collection

comment.author: 38371584@N00
comment._content:

I doubt the Australian libraries will lend books to Los Angeles, California :)

comment._content: I always thought Bird was an excellent name for a flyer.  She was flying during a period before airplanes were reliable like they are now.  Few pilots from that era lived to be 93.

comment.author: 74678182@N00
comment._content: Even so, I wouldn't feel safe in a plane flown by a woman.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content:
I guess a little gender bias is normal, but I have flown with a number of lady pilots.  Generally, they are excellent.  Women competing in a man's field are usually outstanding.  I think it brings out the best in them. 

The reverse is also true.  As a male elementary teacher, I always felt a need to be as good or better than my female colleagues.  Human nature, I suppose.
